title: Revolution Part 2 - Guerilla Warfare
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Analysis of guerilla warfare tactics through history including psychological operations, modern examples, and the legendary Hannibal Barca campaigns

opening_quotes.machiavelli: Differences between the conduct of the multitude and the conduct of the princes do not derive from differences in their nature... rather, they derive from differences in their respect for the laws under which they live.
opening_quotes.polybius_on_state_decline: When a state after having passed with safety through many great dangers arrives at the higher degree of power... the desire of power and rule will first begin to work the ruin of the republic; arrogance and luxury will afterwards advance it
opening_quotes.marsresident_note: Polybius was right about why States fall, but he added the negative part at the end because he was an asshole

psychological_operations.source: CIA manual: Psychological Operations in Guerilla Warfare

key_principles.community_trust: People instinctively believe armed group's guns may be turned on them
key_principles.solution: Guerillas must hang up guns and help community, teach gun use person-to-person
key_principles.transparency: Tell community to keep nothing secret, tell Government everything they feel like
key_principles.education: Cadres and education of Guerillas, equality among Guerillas, everyone knows WHY

psychological_operations.staging: Political takeovers of regions using Demonstrations/Protests

hannibal_barca.polybius_quote: Of all that befell the Romans, the cause was one man and one mind. Hannibal.
hannibal_barca.roman_response: Banned the word 'Peace', coined 'Hannibal is at the gates'

background.brother: Mago - Commander AND Fire Eater (both equally important)

oath.event: Father held young Hannibal over sacrificial fire to Ba'alhammon
oath.oath: Swear to never be a friend to Rome

hannibal_barca.nueva_carthago: Father established New Carthage in Spain/France from Roman negotiations

war_trigger.event: Attacked city on his side of river, Rome claimed it was their ally
war_trigger.emissary: 'In the folds of my toga I hold peace and war, which will you have'

hannibal_barca.route: Through Alps via Hercules path instead of boats from Africa

battle_of_trebia.achievement: Forced Romans to evacuate plain of Lombardy
battle_of_trebia.note: Scipio severely injured, saved only by son who rescued him

battle_of_lake_trasimene.achievement: Destroyed Flaminius' army in waters or adjoining slopes, killed Flaminius
battle_of_lake_trasimene.significance: Most costly ambush Romans sustained until Battle of Carrhae against Parthians
battle_of_lake_trasimene.innovation: First recorded turning movement in military history

gisgo_exchange.gisgo: 'It is most amazing thing to see such a number of men'
gisgo_exchange.hannibal: 'I'll tell you something more amazing. In all those numbers, there is not one among them named Gisgo'

battle_of_cannae.tactic: Envelopment - weak center with strong wings, cavalry attack from behind
battle_of_cannae.casualties: Roman Consul, two previous year consuls, two quaestors, 29 of 48 military tribunes, 80 senators (25-30% of Senate)
battle_of_cannae.significance: One of most catastrophic defeats in Roman history, one of bloodiest battles in human history (single day)

aftermath.roman_response: Never confronted Hannibal in pitched battle again
aftermath.maharbal_quote: 'Hannibal, you know how to gain a victory, but not how to use one'
aftermath.alliances: Greek cities in Sicily revolted, Macedonian King Philip V allied, First Macedonian War began

quiz_questions.q: What is the key principle of psychological operations according to the CIA manual?
quiz_questions.a: Guerillas must make people believe guns are there FOR them, not against them - help community, be transparent
quiz_questions.explanation: Tell community to tell Government everything - builds trust

quiz_questions.q: What oath did young Hannibal swear to his father?
quiz_questions.a: To never be a friend to Rome - sworn over sacrificial fire to Ba'alhammon
quiz_questions.explanation: Father Hamilcar Barca raised him to defeat Rome

quiz_questions.q: What was unprecedented about the Battle of Cannae?
quiz_questions.a: 45,000 defeated 85,000 through envelopment - killed 25-30% of Roman Senate in one day
quiz_questions.explanation: One of bloodiest single-day battles in human history

quiz_questions.q: What does 'Antifa' actually mean and where does it come from?
quiz_questions.a: Anti-Fascist - from Italian resistance movement against German/Fascist occupation in WWII
quiz_questions.explanation: Modern Italian Republic declared to be founded on resistance struggle

quiz_questions.q: What did Maharbal say after Cannae about Hannibal?
quiz_questions.a: 'Hannibal, you know how to gain a victory, but not how to use one'
quiz_questions.explanation: Hannibal never attacked Rome directly despite destroying their armies
